# shared

**Type Property**

The shared URL cache instance.

## Declaration

```swift
class var shared: URLCache { get set }
```

## Discussion

If your app doesn’t have special caching requirements or constraints, the default shared cache instance should be acceptable. Alternatively, you can create a custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLCache] object and set it as the shared cache instance (use `+[NSURLCache setSharedURLCache]` in Objective-C). You should do so before making any calls to this method.

## Related Documentation

- **Accessing cached data**: Control how URL requests make use of previously cached data.
